articles.title: Ceremony of Completion of War Martyrs Cemetery Held in Presence of Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Ceremony of Completion of War Martyrs Cemetery Held in Presence of Kim Jong Un 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery was successfully built in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 There stands a monument bearing President Kim Il Sung's proposition at the cemetery. It reads: "Heroic feats and undying exploits performed by the service personnel of the People's Army in the Fatherland Liberation War will always remain in the revolutionary history of our people in golden letters and they will be conveyed down through generations. Kim Il Sung."
					
					 The cemetery consists of the gatepost built in a peculiar style on the basis of formative art around the Memorial Tower of the People's Army Martyrs, wreath-laying stand "Soul of Heroes", monument to a poem dedicated to hero soldiers and groups of sculptures. Remains of at least 500 martyrs are entombed in the cemetery. 
					
					 A solemn ceremony was held on Thursday in the presence of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Present there were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior officials of the party, state and army, delegates of war veterans, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, families of martyrs, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, merited persons, citizens, overseas Korean delegations and Koreans from abroad and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies here, foreign delegations, delegates and guests staying here to participate in the celebrations of the 60th war victory anniversary. 
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, declared the ceremony of the completion opened. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un cut the tape to inaugurate the cemetery. 
					
					 A wreath in the name of Kim Jong Un was laid on the wreath-laying stand. 
					
					 Then followed a wreath in the joint name of the C.C., WPK and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the DPRK National Defence Commission, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and Cabinet of the DPRK. 
					
					 A wreath in the name of all the Koreans was also laid there. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un paid silent tribute to fallen fighters of the People's Army. 
					
					 All the participants paid high respects for the martyrs. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un went round the cemetery together with senior officials of the party, state and army, delegates of war veterans, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies, foreign delegations, delegates and guests and overseas Koreans.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets Delegation of PRC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets Delegation of PRC
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received the delegation of the People's Republic of China (PRC) led by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) and vice-president of the PRC, on Thursday.
					 The delegation is visiting the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Present there were Zhang Yesui, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jia Tingan, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Chen Fengxiang, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the CPC, Bing Zhigang, vice-governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government, Chen Weigen, vice-governor of the Jilin Provincial People's Government, and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, who are members of the delegation.
					
					 Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, was present there.
					
					 Kim Jong Un received Li Yuanchao and members of the delegation and had a conversation with them.
					
					 Li Yuanchao conveyed the warm greetings and a verbal message of Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Central Committee of the CPC and president of the PRC, to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Expressing thanks to Kim Jong Un for receiving the delegation, though he is very busy leading the struggle for building a thriving nation, Li Yuanchao extended warmest congratulations to the Korean people who are greeting the significant July 27 on behalf of the Chinese party and government.
					
					 He said that the delegation came to the DPRK with a mission to preserve and glorify down through generations the blood-sealed militant friendship between the armies and peoples of the two countries.
					
					The Chinese party and government are rejoiced over the great achievements made by the Korean people in their efforts for building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, he said, adding:
					
					 The two countries are the friendly neighbors. It is the consistent policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily consolidate the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					The Chinese party and government set great store by the Sino-DPRK friendly relations provided and cultivated by the elder generation of the two parties and countries and the new collective leadership of the CPC together with the party and government of the DPRK will respect and trust each other and put spurs to the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations through friendly exchange and cooperation.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly welcomed the delegation's visit to the DPRK and extended warm greetings to the collective leadership of the CPC with Xi Jinping as its general secretary and the Chinese people.
					
					 He expressed thanks to the Chinese party and government for dispatching the delegation of the People's Republic of China to the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will always remember the disinterested internationalist assistance rendered by the Chinese party, government and people to the Korean people during the past Fatherland Liberation War and the exploits the fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers performed in the war, he noted.
					
					 It is the steadfast will of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people to consolidate the traditional DPRK-China friendship down through generations, he said, expressing belief that the invincible vitality of this friendship, the common treasure of the two peoples, would be more powerfully demonstrated in the future thanks to the joint efforts of both sides in the future.
					
					 He exchanged with the guests views on the issue of boosting the relations between the two countries and the matter of ensuring peace and security in Northeast Asia and the world and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					 The conversation proceeded in a friendly and amicable atmosphere.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift of best wishes by Li Yuanchao.
					
					 He expressed thanks for this and had a photo session with all members of the delegation and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met the delegation of the People's Republic of China led by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the PRC, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday when the delegation paid a courtesy call on him. 
					 He had a friendly talk with the delegation.
					
					 Present there were Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Lieutenant General of the Korean People's Army Ryom Chol Song, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Li Yuanchao said he was deeply moved by warm welcome of the Korean people.
					
					 Noting he was pleased that the delegation is attending the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Korean war upon the authorization of the Chinese party and government, he stressed that the Sino-DPRK relations are the ones sealed in blood.
					
					 When the DPRK faced grim ordeals on this land, the Chinese people fought shoulder to shoulder with the Korean people and won a victory, he said.
					
					 We can never allow the dark cloud of a war to hang in the sky above this land again, he stressed.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship is a precious asset bequeathed by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries, he said, expressing belief that the friendly relations would steadily grow strong in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and boosting cooperation.

articles.title: Reception Given for PRC Delegation
articles.content:
Reception Given for PRC Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK hosted a reception for a delegation of the People's Republic of China (PRC) at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					 The delegation is on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the members of the PRC delegation headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the PRC, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and officials concerned were present.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in a speech it is an important occasion of fully demonstrating the solidity of the traditional DPRK-China friendship before the world to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war together with close Chinese comrades.
					
					 The heroic feats of the Chinese People's Volunteers left in the mountains and fields in Korea will shine long and the Korean people will never forget the history in which they fought bloody battles in the same trench with the Chinese people though 60 years have passed since the war victory day, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the DPRK-China friendship would grow stronger with the concerted efforts of both sides. 
					
					 Li Yuanchao said in a speech that to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war together with the Korean people is to look back upon the past days, face up to the future, defend peace and security and make progress.
					
					 Both sides should steadily strengthen exchange and cooperation in various fields and thus promote good-neighborly relations and boost cooperation between the two countries, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Sino-DPRK relations would contribute to ensuring regional and global peace and stability and bring more wellbeing to the peoples of the two countries under the deep attentions of their leaders.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on July 11.
					 The message said:
					
					 Extending warm congratulations to Your Excellency on behalf of the Algerian people, government and myself on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, I am pleased to wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people progress and prosperity.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I would like to express my will to make efforts for the sustained development of the relations of friendship and solidarity between our two countries and two peoples.
					
					 Extending congratulations to Your Excellency once again, I express my best regards.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, on July 3.
					 The Ugandan president in the message extended heart-felt congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Ugandan government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of July 27, 2013, the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The DPRK thwarted the foreign armed intervention forces, a demonstration of the strong will of its people to defend the national sovereignty, dignity and independence, he said.
					
					 Uganda values the strong partnership with the DPRK, he added.
					
					 He reaffirmed that he would continue to make joint efforts with Kim Jong Un and the government of the DPRK to promote the well-being of the two peoples and further develop the precious bilateral cooperation.
					
					 He extended the warmest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un, expressing his best regards.

articles.title: Foreign Military Delegations Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Foreign Military Delegations Visit Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan high-level military delegation headed by Odongo Jeje, minister of state for the Ministry of Defense, and the Mozambican military delegation headed by Agostinho Salvador Mondlane, vice-minister of Defense, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Thursday.
					 The guests went round historic relics in the birthplace of the President, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and his family in Mangyongdae.
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the Ugandan high-level military delegation said the President brought freedom and liberation to the Korean people and led the Fatherland Liberation War to a victory.
					
					 The head of the Mozambican military delegation noted that the President, who was born at the low-roofed thatched house in Mangyongdae, devoted his all to the struggle for the people's freedom and liberation. 
					
					The President was a peerlessly great man whom the Korean and Mozambican peoples and the world people deeply revere, he added.
					
					 Meanwhile, the delegations visited the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					
					 The Mongolian government military delegation headed by Avirmed Battor, vice-minister of Defence, and the Vietnamese military delegation headed by Luong Cong, deputy head of the General Political Department of the Vietnam People's Army, visited the Museum of Weapons and Equipment of the Korean People's Army on the same day.

articles.title: NDC Gives Banquet for Chinese War Veterans Delegations
articles.content:
NDC Gives Banquet for Chinese War Veterans Delegations
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission (NDC) of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea hosted a banquet at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Thursday in honor of the delegation of war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) and the delegation of war veterans and families of martyrs of the CPV who are here to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there on invitation were the members of the delegations and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 On hand were Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the NDC, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Kim Yong Chun in his speech said that the great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War is associated with the blood shed by the brave fighters of the CPV who fought on the Korean fronts in hearty response to the call of Mao Zedong, the great leader of the Chinese people, and the Chinese party and government.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to boosting the DPRK-China friendship, true to the high intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever make joint efforts with Chinese comrades to further develop the bilateral friendly relations. 
					
					 Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army who is heading the delegation of war veterans delegation of the CPV, said that the Chinese people fought shoulder to shoulder with the Korean people and won a victory in the struggle against the common enemies, holding high the banner of resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland, and thus made the U.S. imperialists sign the document of the Armistice Agreement.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Sino-DPRK friendship sealed in blood thanks to the joint efforts of the two peoples would steadily grow strong in the future, too.

articles.title: Syrian Charge d 'Affaires ad Interim Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Syrian Charge d 'Affaires ad Interim Hosts Reception
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Syrian Charge d 'Affaires ad interim Haissam Saad hosted a reception at his embassy on Thursday to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (FLW).
					 Present there on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present there were the Syrian delegation headed by Abdullah al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, and a staff member of the embassy.
					
					 Haissam Saad said that he was pleased to greet the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war together with the Korean people.
					
					 The friendly relations between Syria and the DPRK provided by Hafez Al-Assad and President Kim Il Sung have been developed by Bashar Al-Assad and Marshal Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 He said he was very thankful that Kim Jong Un received the Syrian delegation.
					
					 He warmly congratulated the Korean people who are holding such great man as Kim Jong Un as their supreme leader.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok said that the friends of Syria are celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the FLW like their holiday, adding that this encourages the Korean people vigorously advancing for the final victory in the struggle for building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 60 years ago the Korean people defeated U.S. imperialism under the leadership of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, an invincible and iron-willed commander and outstanding military strategist, he stressed, adding:
					
					 The WPK and the DPRK government will extend full support and solidarity to the fraternal Syrian government and people in their just struggle for defending sovereignty, peace and security of the country.

articles.title: Reception Given for Foreign Military Delegations, Military Attaches
articles.content:
Reception Given for Foreign Military Delegations, Military Attaches
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Thursday hosted a reception for the visiting military delegations of various countries and military attaches of foreign embassies here to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there on invitation were the Ugandan high-level military delegation, the Mongolian government military delegation, the Mozambican military delegation, the Vietnamese military delegation, the Iranian military delegation, the Tanzanian military delegation and the military attache corps here.
					
					 Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Phyo Yong, vice-minister, and other generals and officers of the Korean People's Army were on hand.
					
					 Jang Jong Nam said in a speech at the reception that President Kim Il Sung wisely led the Korean army and people to victory, defeating the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He recalled that the people of China, Russia and other people around the world people who loved justice and peace and opposed aggression rendered sincere support, material and moral, and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 July 27, the day of victory will always be in store for the DPRK invariably advancing along the road of independence, the road of Songun and the road of socialism by carrying forward the tradition of victory in the 1950s, single-mindedly united around Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, he stressed.
					
					 We will as ever make joint efforts to build a new independent world, peaceful and prosperous, in the idea of independence, friendship and peace together with the peace-loving countries which are friendly towards our country, he concluded.
					
					 Odongo Jeje, minister of state for the Ministry of Defense of Uganda who is heading the Ugandan high-level military delegation, said: The struggle of the heroic Korean people to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country serves as an example to us. I was deeply moved after witnessing the Korean people's struggle. Through the visit I saw the reality totally different from the one described by the Western media.

articles.title: Jonsung Revolutionary Museum Renovated in DPRK
articles.content:
Jonsung Revolutionary Museum Renovated in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Jonsung Revolutionary Museum has been renovated as required by the new century. The museum is associated with the undying feats of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung.
					 It has been rebuilt on an expansion basis as befits a center for education in his greatness. The system and form of displaying historic relics and data have been further completed so as to show well the feats Kim Il Sung performed by winning a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Displayed in the front hall of the museum is a photo of Kim Il Sung examining and ratifying the document of the Armistice Agreement.
					
					 New exhibits include photos "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Bringing About a Brilliant Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War" and "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Giving Teachings on Increasing Production of Ordnance".
					
					 Inner rooms of the museum have been spruced up on the principle of preserving and managing revolutionary relics, and historic relics and data supplemented and the building of the museum renovated to its original state.
					
					 Among them is a historic datum on the undying leadership feats and personality of Kim Il Sung giving teachings while receiving farmer Yun Ok Gi who attended the national meeting of active farmers.
					
					 There are also a scene of documentary film showing Kim Il Sung making a speech at the Pyongyang city mass rally for celebrating the  victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, posters created during the war under his leadership and multi media showing the policies of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government on stabilizing the people's living.
					
					 More than 100 pieces of relics were discovered to be put on display.
					
					 A room used as office by Kim Il Sung during the war, a house where he guided the work of the Military Commission, a house where he examined and ratified the document of the Armistice Agreement, a pit where he worked, etc. have been renovated to their original state.
					
					 A general lecture hall has also been expanded, giving a face-lift to the museum.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Mark Anniversary of Victory in War
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Mark Anniversary of Victory in War
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign crewmen met at Haeju Port in South Hwanghae Province Thursday to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The participants laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung in Haeju City and paid tribute to him.
					
					 It was attended by crewmen of a Cambodian-flagged ship.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said that the Korean people humbled the arrogance of the U.S. imperialists and won a brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 They expressed belief that the army and people of the DPRK marking July 27, the day of victory, would glorify forever the exploits performed by Generalissimo Kim Il Sung for winning a victory in the war and firmly defend the socialist country, united close around Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 At the end of the meeting its participants watched a Korean film.

articles.title: Dancing Party of Service Personnel Marks War Victory Day
articles.content:
Dancing Party of Service Personnel Marks War Victory Day
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A dancing party of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces took place Thursday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The dancing party began with song "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung". The participants danced calling back the feats of President Kim Il Sung, who beat back the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world and won a shining victory, and those of leader Kim Jong Il, who glorified the history and tradition of war victory with his unique Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 They danced to the tune of "Our July 27", "Song of National Defence", "Advance", "Our General Is the Best" and other songs.
					
					 The atmosphere has mounted as loud singing of the service personnel and their hand-clapping reflected their belief that as there is Marshal Kim Jong Un, the bright future of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea is guaranteed.
					
					 The party strikingly demonstrated the steadfast will of the service personnel to eternally glorify the ever-victorious history and tradition and bring about the final victory without fail under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Art Performance Given at Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Art Performance Given at Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by art group members of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Thursday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The performance started with prologue "We Sing of Our July 27".  Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as quintet and chorus "Let Star of Generalissimo Shine Forever" and dance and story telling "The General Goes to Front while Children Go to Camps". 
					
					 The performers highly praised the feats Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in the war and the Songun revolution.
					
					 Also put on the stage were numbers truthfully depicting the happy and cheerful schoolchildren bringing their hopes into full bloom under the warm care of Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is creditably carrying forward the deep love of the Generalissimos for the younger generation.
					
					 The performance came to a close with epilogue "July 27 March."
					
					 It clearly demonstrated the unshakable will of schoolchildren to fully prepare themselves as successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, holding the Generalissimos in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche. 
					
					 Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the youth league central committee, and others enjoyed the performance.

articles.title: Gold Order to Kim Jong Un from Germany
articles.content:
Gold Order to Kim Jong Un from Germany
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was awarded gold order "Star of International Friendship" by the Germany-Ukraine Centre on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 An awarding ceremony took place in Berlin on July 20.
					
					 The order and certificate were conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Germany.
					
					 The certificate said:
					
					 The Standing Committee of the centre awards the gold order "Star of International Friendship" to Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, who has performed extraordinary exploits in promoting the understanding and humanity between the peoples and in defending peace.
					
					 The chairman of the centre said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il won in the struggle against the hostile forces' all sorts of arbitrary practices in the whole period of leading the Korean revolution, pursuing the politics of independence, Songun politics.
					
					 The centre paid tribute to Kim Jong Un, who has completely contained the U.S. and reliably defended the world peace and security by creditably carrying forward the political mode of the preceding leaders, and decided to award the order, wishing him greater success in his future work, he added.

articles.title: Panmunjom Draws Many Servicepersons of KPA
articles.content:
Panmunjom Draws Many Servicepersons of KPA 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Army are now visiting the room where armistice talks were held and the hall where the armistice agreement was signed in Panmunjom on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 It was there that the U.S. imperialists signed the document of surrender after being defeated in the Korean War by the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 Visitors looked back with deep emotion on the undying feats President Kim Il Sung performed by leading the Fatherland Liberation War to victory and saving again the destiny of the country and the nation. 
					
					 They went round the room and hall, being briefed on the fact that Kim Il Sung made the U.S. imperialists meet a destiny like the setting sun. 
					
					 Watching the flag of the DPRK, the document of the Armistice Agreement and others preserved as evidence of history, the visitors felt once again the pride and honor as the revolutionary army of heroic Korea which defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world. 
					
					 They expressed the firm will to annihilate all the aggressors so that there would be no more enemies who would sign such document of surrender if they receive an order from Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Int'l Meeting Denounces GIs' Atrocities during Korean War
articles.content:
Int'l Meeting Denounces GIs' Atrocities during Korean War 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- An international meeting denouncing GIs' atrocities committed in the Korean War took place in Pamnamu-gol (chestnut valley) of Wonam-ri, Sinchon County of South Hwanghae Province on Thursday. 
					 Present at the meeting were delegations of foreign friendship and solidarity organizations and international bodies and foreign delegates and guests. 
					
					 Attending it were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea and vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and people in Sinchon County. 
					
					 Prior to the meeting the participants laid bouquets before the grave of 400 mothers and the grave of 102 children before paying silent tribute to those killed. 
					
					 Speeches were made by former Attorney General of the U.S. Ramsey Clark, President of the Women's International Democratic Federation Marcia de Campos Pereira, the head of the delegation of Turkey-Korea Friendship Association and Kim Jin Bom. 
					
					 They said that massacres of civilians by GIs during the Korean War laid bare the true colors of the U.S. styling itself "champion of peace and human rights". 
					
					 They strongly urged the U.S. to stop at once the hostile moves and nuclear war moves against the DPRK and refrain from acts of obstructing the reunification of Korea and disturbing peace and stability. 
					
					 An appeal in the name of the participants to the world progressives who love justice and peace was read out at the meeting. 
					
					 It called for dynamically launching worldwide actions for forcing the U.S. to make an apology and compensate for all the crimes and atrocities it committed against the Korean people including massacres of civilians. 
					
					 It also called for conducting diverse activities demanding the dismantlement of the "UN Command" and withdrawal of its troops from south Korea and an early conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: Chief of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Interviewed
articles.content:
Chief of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Interviewed 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF), Jo Il Min, was interviewed by KCNA Thursday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 He said July 27 is a day when the Korean nation won a great victory after shattering the myth of the "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists. He added:
					
					 The war victory was a precious fruition brought about by President Kim Il Sung's Juche-oriented military idea, strategy and tactics and outstanding commanding arts.
					
					 The President was a gifted strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 The feats by the President, who demonstrated the stamina of heroic Korea all over the world, will shine long.
					
					 The history of the President, who won a victory in the war against the U.S., is being carried forward.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is standing in the van of the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 The hot wind of Kim Jong Un is raging all over south Korea now.
					
					 Jaju Minbo and other internet media are vying with each other to report the news of his field guidance, praising him as leader with the pluck to make the whole world look up to Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's nation.
					
					 It is immense honor and fortune for the 70 million Koreans that they are holding the Marshal, who is glorifying the history of war victory with Songun politics, as the leader of the nation.
					
					 As there is Kim Jong Un, the ever-victorious history and tradition of the Korean nation will be ever-lasting.
					
					 The vanguard fighters of the AINDF and patriotic people will wage dynamic struggle to end the U.S. military presence and domination and bring about a new society of independence, new dawn of reunification.

articles.title: U.S. Destroys Civilian Facilities in Korean War
articles.content:
U.S. Destroys Civilian Facilities in Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- In the period of the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953), the U.S. imperialists destroyed almost all industrial establishments, health and welfare facilities and historical relics in the territory of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Their destroying activities reached the height when they were forced to make a retreat from temporarily occupied areas.
					
					 In August 1952, the commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East issued an order to eliminate 78 cities in the DPRK and announced a "strike plan" for its implementation.
					
					 Accordingly, hundreds of U.S. airplanes bombed the Suphung, Jangjingang, Pujongang and Hochongang hydraulic power stations.
					
					 The bombing left a number of industrial establishments destroyed and hundreds of thousands of hectares of farmland ravaged, reducing to ashes more than 600 000 dwelling houses, 5 000 schools, 1 000 hospitals and clinics, 260 theatres and cinemas and thousands of cultural and welfare buildings.
					
					 The invaders destroyed or took away thousands of pieces of cultural relics and remains.
					
					 They used the three tombs of Kangso, national heritages, as storehouses and dropped a bomb on the old tomb of Anak in Hwanghae Province.
					
					 The U.S. airplanes raided the Pohyon Temple in Mt. Myohyang, burning away more than 1 000 pieces of historical relics, including the Complete Collection of the Buddhist Scriptures of Koryo (918-1392).
					
					 An investigation group of the International Association of Democratic Lawyers said in its report that the U.S. actions were criminal in their planning, beginning and practice.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries dedicated special write-ups to the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The July 19th issue of the Lao newspaper Pasason carried an article titled "A rare strategist" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The Korean people's victory in the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War would be unthinkable without the rare strategy of the President.
					
					 Soon after the outbreak of the war, he issued an order to frustrate the invaders' offensive and make a prompt counteroffensive.
					
					 By his order the Korean People's Army liberated Seoul, a bulwark of the enemies, only 3 days after the start of war.
					
					 The world history of wars does not know such an example of a country repelling the enemies' attack at the beginning of the war and turning the tide of the war.
					
					 The paper conveyed in detail the fact that the KPA won one victory after another in every phase of the war and achieved the final victory as the President set forth his unique war methods.
					
					 The July 18th issue of the Indonesian newspaper International Media allotted one whole page to photos of President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper in its article titled "60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War" said that the U.S. imperialists ignited an aggressive war against the young DPRK 60 years ago and mobilized a lot of arms but they suffered a bitter defeat. Still they are pursuing the hostile policy to the DPRK.
					
					 The July 19th issue of a Nepalese newspaper carried an article titled "The battle for liberating Taejon" illustrated with a photo of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper introduced the battle for liberating Taejon which was called by world militarists a successful example of the modern siege warfare, noting that the DPRK wrought a lot of military miracles in the past Korean war in which the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" was completely shattered.

articles.title: Events Abroad Mark Korean People's Victory in Korean War
articles.content:
Events Abroad Mark Korean People's Victory in Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A celebration meeting was held in Serbia, a lecture in Russia and a seminar and a film show in Nigeria on July 18 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were figures of various social strata and other people in the above-said countries.
					
					 "Arms of Korea" was screened at the film show.
					
					 The general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party said as follows:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists tried to bring the Korean people on their knees by all means including the use of germ and chemical weapons and the mobilization of troops of their satellite countries and the south Korean puppet army in the Korean war.
					
					 But the Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, an iron-willed commander and outstanding strategist and thus energetically encouraged the world oppressed people in their struggle for national liberation against imperialism.
					
					 If the U.S. dares ignite the second Korean war, far from drawing a lesson from the past days, it will meet a worse defeat.
					
					 The chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia praised Kim Il Sung as father of the Korean nation who defeated Japanese imperialism and achieved Korea's liberation, a great leader who shattered the U.S. aggression  and its followers in the early 1950's and defended the dignity of the country and nation, and a peerlessly brilliant commander who developed the KPA into an invincible and formidable army.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy said the DPRK's army and people continue their confrontation with the U.S., noting that the progressive people support the Korean people resolutely standing against the U.S. and its followers hell-bent on the high-handed and tyrannical practice.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Khmer Democratic Party was inaugurated in Cambodia on July 21 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Ouk Phurik, president of the Party, was elected the chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to set the days from July 21 to 31 as a celebration period and widely introduce the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in the Fatherland Liberation War and his immortal exploits in the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Cambodia, and organize colorful political and cultural events during the period.

articles.title: Heroic Korean People's Victory in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Heroic Korean People's Victory in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean army and people's matchless self-sacrificing spirit and popular heroism displayed during the Fatherland Liberation War are being given unstinted appreciation by the world community.
					 The Russian newspaper Vladivostok said as follows:
					
					 Many people of the world expressed their concerns when the U.S., which boasted of knowing not a single defeat in its history of wars, invaded the DPRK, which was less than two years old.
					
					 But the Korean war proved that the strong military technique of the U.S., a country which boasted of the "myth" of invincibility, was by no means almighty.
					
					 The Cambodian newspaper Pracheachon noted as follows:
					
					 In order to stifle the DPRK in its bud the U.S. fed to the Korean war over 2 million-strong forces including its army, troops of its 15 satellite countries and the puppet south Korean army as well as modern military equipment.
					
					 But the war ended with the U.S. defeat. 
					
					 The event that brought the first defeat to the U.S. in history startled the world.
					
					 The British Branch of the Friendship Association with Korea in its statement said that the Korean people's victory in the war against U.S. imperialism showed that even a small country can surely defeat any formidable enemy if its people firmly unite around their leader and fight by displaying the strong will and fighting spirit.
					
					 The chairman of the Finland-Korea Society said that the world progressive people praise the Korean people as the heroic people who defeated the U.S. imperialists for the first time in the world.
					
					 The Indian newspaper Indian and World Event emphasized that the U.S. defeat in the Korean war awakened the international community to the truth that no force on earth could overpower the Korean army and people led by President Kim Il Sung, an iron-willed brilliant commander.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats in War Praised by Russian Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats in War Praised by Russian Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Russian newspapers dedicated special write-ups on July 17 and 18 to the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Russian newspaper Nakhodkinski Rabochi carried articles illustrated with photos of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and pictures documenting the revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Iron-willed brilliant commander" noted that the young DPRK made a miracle unknown by the history in the confrontation with the U.S. that boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, troops of its 15 following countries, the south Korean puppet army and remnants of the Imperial Japanese Army 60 years ago, adding that it was Kim Il Sung, the founder of socialist Korea, who wrought the miracle.
					
					 The Russian newspaper My Home-Sochi carried an article titled "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" illustrated with a photo of the smiling President and pictures dealing with the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Il Sung created various military methods in each period and at each stage of the war, enabling the Korean army to wipe out the enemy's forces nonstop.
					
					 The U.S. advantages in military technique were completely shattered by the military methods of Kim Il Sung, who always held the initiative in the war and endlessly changed his tactics.
					
					 At last the U.S. was compelled to kneel down to the Korean people.
					
					 The miraculous victory achieved by the Korean people in the Korean war was a fruition of the outstanding strategy and tactics, unique military methods and arts of command possessed by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The Russian newspaper Komsomolskaya Pravda in its article illustrated with photos documenting Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities praised the immortal exploits of the iron-willed brilliant commander who led the battle for liberating Taejon to victory and set a brilliant example of the modern siege warfare.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits in War Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits in War Praised Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The world public praised the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung, who led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory.
					 The Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union and the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a joint statement stressed that the President, who led the Korean war to victory and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism, was an outstanding strategist and an invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 The member of the Executive Committee of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar praised the President for setting forth his unique military idea that the factor of victory in war lies not in the armed equipment and the level of the military technique but in the military personnel themselves, and led the army and people to victory.
					
					 The president of the Socialist Party of Benin emphasized that the human history does not know such a brilliant commander and general mastered in pen and sword as the President, who held arms all his life and demonstrated the invincibility by his prominent strategy and commanding arts on the forefront of confrontation with imperialism.
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan said the President laid out his unique military methods and led the Korean People's Army to victory, adding that the Korean people's historic victory would have been unthinkable without his rare strategy and tactics.
					
					 The chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said as follows:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was a great leader who defeated two imperialisms in one generation and ushered in a new era of independence against imperialism.
					
					 He was an iron-willed brilliant commander who wisely led the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War and a symbol of eternal victory in the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Maldives
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Maldives
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Mohammed Waheed Hassan, president of Maldives, on the occasion of the anniversary of its independence.

DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction of Apartment Houses for Scientists
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the construction of apartment houses for scientists.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Philippine Ambassador

DPRK FM Meets New Philippine Ambassador

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian FM

Greetings to Syrian FM
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Walid Al-Muallem, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates of Syria, on Thursday on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Syrian Arab Republic.

articles.title: North-South Working-level Talks End in Stalemate
articles.content:
North-South Working-level Talks End in Stalemate
						
 Kaesong, July 25 (KCNA) -- The sixth round of the working-level talks between the authorities of the north and the south of Korea for the normalization of operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone took place in the zone Thursday.
					 At the talks the north side mentioned the need to reduce some differences that still remain and reach at a full agreement as both sides approached much closer on many issues after exchanging draft agreements and sharing full discussions at the past five rounds of talks.
					
					 The north side proposed a realistic and reasonable draft revision of the agreement, fully reflecting the south side's proposals including the issue of refraining from all acts of hindering the operation in the zone so that it may run on a normal basis unaffected by the situation under whatever circumstances, the issue of protecting safety of the personnel entering the zone and the properties invested by south Korean businessmen, the issue of settling communications, passage and customs clearance, the issue of ensuring world-level business activities and developing the zone into an economic zone with international competitive edge, reopening the north-south economic cooperation consultative office, the issue of forming and operating a joint committee, the issue of pushing forward in a simultaneous way the package progress of all the measures taken for the re-starting and normalization of operation in the zone. Both sides held discussions over these issues.
					
					 The north side made a suggestion of reflecting in the agreement the will to give assurances that the north and the south shall refrain from acts of hindering the normal operation of the zone in the meaning that both sides draw a lesson from the past incident and prevent its recurrence as there will be no end if the reason for the suspension of operation in the zone is to be probed and the responsibilities to be taken as for the issue of preventing recurrence and the north side has ample reasons to make claim to the south side as regards the issue.
					
					 As for the issue of the passage, communications and customs clearance, the north side suggested that the north and the south make joint efforts, discuss the issue of ensuring smooth communications through internet communication and mobile phones, streamlining the clearance procedures and cutting down the hours of customs clearance. It proposed referring the relevant military measures to the military authorities of both sides for the discussion and settlement of the issue at military working-level talks between the north and the south.
					
					 The north side also raised a reasonable way of reopening the already established north-south economic cooperation consultative office and providing an institutional mechanism as forming and running the joint committee and setting up necessary panel committees under it.
					
					 Taking into consideration the earnest requests of the south side's businessmen to resume the zone so that they can reduce business damage as much as possible, the north side proposed making package promotion of all the measures for the re-operation and normalization of the zone. It suggested that heads of the delegations, persons directly responsible for the discussion, sign the agreement upon authorization.
					
					 But the south side came to the talks without any substantial preparations and only shunned the sincere efforts exerted by the north side for the successful talks. It consistently claimed that the north side is to blame for the suspension of the zone and made uncouth assertions that the north side should compensate for the damage.
					
					 The south side also asserted that this is its fixed stand and urged that unless the north side accepts it, there can never be the normalization of the zone.
					
					 The south side openly resorted to delaying tactics, taking an insincere approach to the talks even before 4 o'clock in the afternoon.
					
					 The north side made every possible effort to prevent the talks from not making any results but the south side persisted in its arrogant stand, pushing the talks to the point of stalemate.
					
					 The north side held a press conference on the spot right away and vehemently denounced the south side for torpedoing the talks.
					
					 The south side can never escape its responsibility for all the aftermaths to be entailed by its move of having pushed the talks to a deadlock.

articles.title: DPRK, Ecuador Sign Agreement on Establishing Sister City Relations
articles.content:
DPRK, Ecuador Sign Agreement on Establishing Sister City Relations 
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing sister city relations between Songrim City, North Hwanghae Province, the DPRK and Deleg City, Canar Pronvice, Ecuador was signed in Songrim City on Thursday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Hyon Ae Gyong, chairwoman of the Songrim City People's Committee, officials concerned and from the Ecuadorian side the members of the delegation of Deleg City, Canar Province headed by Mayor Tito Quizhpi Dario.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-Do Team Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-Do Team Returns Home
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Taekwon-Do team led by Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who doubles as chairman of the Asian Taekwon-Do Federation, returned home on Thursday after participating in the 18th World Taekwon-Do Championship held in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Premier Soccer League Matches Begin in DPRK
articles.content:
Premier Soccer League Matches Begin in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The premier soccer league matches began in the DPRK to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. They are to last from July 25 to August 3.
					 The competing teams include men's premier soccer teams of April 25, Hwaebul, Rimyongsu and Amnokgang and women's premier soccer teams of April 25, Sobaeksu, Ponghwasan, Myohyangsan, Taesongsan.
					
					 There were matches between the April 25 and Myohyangsan teams and between the Sobaeksu and Taesongsan teams in the soccer ground of the Chobyong Sports Team on Thursday.
					
					 The April 25 team beat its rival 3:0 and the Sobaeksu team its rival 2:1.
					
					 The matches go on.

articles.title: Aeguk Moran Garment Factory
articles.content:
Aeguk Moran Garment Factory
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Aeguk Moran Garment Factory here is well known among local people for its "Moran"-trademarked men's clothes. 
					 The trademark is named after Moran Hill in Pyongyang.
					
					 Built in Juche 75 (1986), all processes of the factory are streamlined, ranging from cutting to processing.
					
					 Supported by software, designing is done by some ten people in their 30s.
					
					 The quality of the factory's products is guaranteed by its workers' high skill.

articles.title: Naegumgang Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Naegumgang Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Naegumgang (Inner Kumgang) Revolutionary Site is located in the scenic Mt. Kumgang of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A sanatorium of the Front Command was situated in Naegumgang in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953).
					
					 Barracks, mess hall and a spring site are preserved in its original state.
					
					 As the war dragged on, President Kim Il Sung, on May 25, Juche 40 (1951), took a measure to set up a sanatorium there for soldiers.
					
					 On October 2, 1952, he went to the sanatorium to learn about the living conditions of the resters.
					
					 He touched a soldier's wounded leg with his hand and hoped that he would recover from the wound during the rest.
					
					 He dropped in a kitchen, asking the cooks to make various kinds of tasty dishes for soldiers.
					
					 He requested officials of the sanatorium to pay deep attention to the soldiers' life before leaving the sanatorium.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Development of New Type Drone
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Development of New Type Drone
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Recently, the U.S. navy conducted  take-off and landing tests of drone X-47B on an aircraft carrier in waters just off the Virginia State despite international protest and denunciation.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is little short of an open declaration of the U.S. that it would boost the drone capability and work hard to strengthen the aggression and military interference by relying on it.
					
					 The new-type drone assumes increasing danger as it has sphere of activities three times as much as the previous one and can take off and land on the deck of aircraft carrier.
					
					 The development of the new-type drone and its deployment can serve as a time bomb that may render the situation in the Asia-Pacific region strained and touch off a new arms race.
					
					  If the U.S. warmongers persist in the military hegemony and steadily pursue the development of drone, the international situation will develop into an unpredictable phase.
					
					 The U.S. has made efforts to realize its ambition to dominate the world by taking the military advantages, remaining utterly indifferent to the security and sovereignty of other nations and defying international denunciation. This is a dangerous criminal action posing threat to the global peace and humankind.
					
					 The U.S. should stop at once the reckless drone development.

articles.title: Paper Calls for Unity for National Reunification
articles.content:
Paper Calls for Unity for National Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday appeals to all the Koreans in the north and the south to terminate the antagonism and confrontation and open a broad way for peace and national reunification by achieving a close unity of patriotic forces for reunification.
					 The national reunification is the cause of the Korean nation that can be achieved independently by its own efforts, the daily says in an article, and goes on:
					
					 It is a common task of the nation and the most patriotic cause to be carried out by the Koreans without fail.
					
					 The national unity of Korea gets more urgent in the light of the present north-south relations and the situation created before the reunification movement.
					
					 The north-south relations deteriorated since the traitor Lee Myung Bak regime took office in south Korea have not seen any sign of improvement after the present regime emerged with the clamor for "confidence".
					
					 The south Korean authorities oppose the national reconciliation and unity and cooperate with foreign forces to escalate confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 This tarnishes the atmosphere of dialogue and peace.
					
					 Now is the time for all the Koreans to demonstrate the might of the united Korean nation for the national reunification under the banner of patriotism.
					
					 When all the countrymen unite closely for the national reunification, they can thoroughly frustrate the obstructive maneuvers of the anti-reunification forces.
					
					 Whoever is truly concerned about the destiny of the country and nation and desirous for the reunified country should oppose the national division and work to achieve unity and solidarity.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges Disbandment of "UN Command"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges Disbandment of "UN Command"
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- It is six decades since the conclusion of the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) but peace and security are not ensured on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 The ceaseless military actions including nuclear blackmail staged by the U.S. imperialists present in south Korea under berets of "UN Forces" are the main factor of the steadily escalating tension on the peninsula and its vicinity.
					
					 "The UN Command" is a war machine illegally made by the U.S. for the purpose of forming an anti-DPRK alliance by mobilizing troops of its satellite countries during the Korean War. 
					
					 While keeping the "UN Command" in south Korea even after the truce, the U.S. claimed that the U.S. military presence there was requested by the UN to justify the command's presence. But this is a fabrication. 
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the U.S. is working hard to turn the command into a U.S.-led "multi-national coalition body" of a reinforced version, for the purpose of strengthening its military hegemony in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 This scenario is based on the "experience" gained by the NATO which played a major role as a military machine targeted on the former Soviet Union and the East European countries during the Cold War. This is, therefore, a very dangerous action aimed at laying a military siege to its potential rivals in the Asia-Pacific region and holding political and military edge in the region. 
					
					 It is the most urgent demand of the times to dismantle the "UN Command" as early as possible because its disbandment was called for at the UN General Assembly as early as in the 1970s and force the U.S. forces to pull back from south Korea. 
					
					 If the presence of the command and the U.S. aggressor forces in south Korea is overlooked, the U.S. will work harder to justify this presence and turn them into aggressor forces with "strategic flexibility" and convert the whole of the Asia-Pacific into a theatre for provoking a nuclear war.
					
					 It is the urgent demand for achieving peace and security on the peninsula and the rest of the Asia-Pacific to get the "UN Command" disbanded and the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea. 
					
					 If the U.S. has a true intention to avert a war on the peninsula and ensure peace there, it should take a bold decision to dismantle the command without delay and get its forces withdrawn from south Korea.

articles.title: U.S. Blamed for Persisting in State of War on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
U.S. Blamed for Persisting in State of War on Korean Peninsula
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- For the past six decades after the war, the U.S. imperialists have worked hard to provoke a new war against the DPRK in wanton violation of the Armistice Agreement (AA) to retrieve its shameful defeat in the Korean War.
					 At around 22:20 on July 27, 1953, in less than half an hour after the AA took effect, the U.S. fired several machine gun bullets into the DPRK side.
					
					 The Panmunjom incident on August 18, 1976, the case of opening fire into guards of the DPRK side on November 23, 1984 and other provocative acts have been committed one after another in the joint security area.
					
					 In less than a decade after the signing of the AA, military airplanes of the U.S. imperialist aggression troops intruded into the sky above the DPRK 693 times with the number of planes mobilized for the mission totaling 1 390.
					
					 EC-121 and other spy planes were shot down or seized but far from drawing a lesson from them, the U.S. continuously flied SR-71 high-speed, high-altitude reconnaissance plane, escalating provocation.
					
					 Spy activities by the U.S. were notably evidenced by the intrusion by armed spy ships Pueblo on January 23, 1968 and I-2 on June 5, 1970.
					
					 The fabrication of the illegal and bogus "northern limit line" was an intentional violation of the AA.
					
					 Acts of wantonly violating the AA in the sky, land and sea of Korea have reached hundreds of thousands which resulted in hundreds of sessions of the military armistice committee for the past six decades.
					
					 The weapons which the U.S. deployed in south Korea for just one year after the war were 240 M-26 tanks, 6 400 rocket launchers, more than 800 artillery pieces with various calibers, nearly 200 operational planes, 1 365 machine guns and tens of thousands of rifles. These are only figures that were revealed.
					
					 In June 1956 the U.S. forcibly expelled the inspection group of the Neutral Nations Supervision Committee from south Korea and declared in June 1957 its unilateral annulment of paragraph 13 d of AA which banned the introduction of operational planes, armored vehicles, weapons and ammunition from outside Korea.
					
					 The U.S. introduction and deployment of nuclear weapons in south Korea have steadily increased with their number exceeding more than 1 000 in the 1970s and reaching over 1 720 in the 1980s, making south Korea a region with the densest deployment of nuclear weapons in the world.
					
					 At the 14th annual security consultative meeting in March 1982, the U.S. made it official to offer a nuclear umbrella to south Korea.
					
					 Early in the 21st century, it adopted it as its policy in its "nuclear posture review" to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 In 2003 the U.S. invested 11 billion U.S. dollars under its new arms buildup plan to further strengthen its aggression troops present in south Korea. 
					
					 Under this plan, it deployed huge attack weapons in south Korea and beefed up cutting-edge preemptive attack weapons in recent years.
					
					 The illegal introduction of war means increased the scope of puppet south Korean army from 16 divisions at the time of the signing of the AA to 31 divisions two years after the signing. The U.S. handed over destroyers, fighters and huge other attack weapons to south Korea, bolstering the combat capacities of naval and air forces.
					
					 The U.S. is still arming the puppet south Korean army with American-made weapons.
					
					 Point 60 of paragraph 4 of the AA provides that all the foreign forces shall be withdrawn from Korea and the Korean issue be settled in a peaceful way.
					
					 But the U.S. instigated the puppet south Korean forces on August 8, 1953 to scrap it by forming the "mutual defence pact" which stipulated the permanent presence of the U.S. forces in south Korea.
					
					 At the time of a meeting of foreign ministers of relevant countries for the peaceful coordination of the Korean issue which was convened in Geneva in April 1954, the U.S. asserted that an election under the U.N supervision shall be organized all over Korea and the U.S. forces shall not pull out of Korea until a unified Korean government is set up. When this assertion was rebuffed, the U.S. scuttled the discussion of the Korean issue itself in June 1954.
					
					 After the adoption of a resolution on dismantling the "UN Command" for the lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula at the 30th UN General Assembly Session in November 1975 the U.S. has become all the more undisguised in its attempt to keep its forces in south Korea on a permanent basis through the fabrication of the U.S.-south Korea "Combined Forces Command".
					
					 Early in March 2006 it crafted a plan on enhancing the role of the countries that participated in the Korean war and allowing their participation in the detailed activities as well as in the working out of the emergency and operational plans in a bid to expand and reorganize the already defunct "UN Command" into a permanent multi-national combined armed forces organization.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces' anti-DPRK nuclear war exercises which started with the codename of Focus Lens in 1954 have been followed by Ulji Focus Lens in 1976 and continued under codename of Ulji Freedom Guardian from 2008.
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises originated from Focus Retina staged by the U.S. and puppet south Korea at the end of the 1960s. In 1971 they continued with codename of Freedom Bolt and changed its codename to Team Spirit from 1976 till it lasted in 1993. Later the codenames changed to Reception, Staging, Onward Movement and Integration, Foal Eagle, Key Resolve and Foal Eagle again.
					
					 The number of other DPRK-targeted war exercises and military drills staged in south Korea totaled over 18 000, when counting only those made public.
					
					 It is due to such acts of the U.S. that the original meaning of armistice has disappeared from the Korean Peninsula in the true sense of words and the evil cycle of escalation of tension and war crisis has repeated.

articles.title: S. Korean Security Authorities' Suppression of South HQs of Pomminryon under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Security Authorities' Suppression of South HQs of Pomminryon under Fire 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) released a statement on July 20 protesting against the south Korean security authorities' suppression of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					 The statement accused the authorities of detaining Kim Ul Su, acting chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, in the wake of their arrest of Kim Se Chang, a member of the Organizing Committee of the headquarters.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 This repressive campaign was prompted by their foolish scenario to weather their ruling crisis caused by the Intelligence Service's election coup through their crackdown upon the headquarters and attribute the candlelight actions now spreading like a prairie fire to the agitation by the forces following the north.
					
					 It is the immutable truth that sycophancy and treachery can never prevail over independence and patriotism, it held.

					 The statement demanded the south Korean security authorities halt at once the suppression of the headquarters and unconditionally free all the detained pro-reunification patriots.

articles.title: Wholesale Arrests of Members of S. HQs of Pomminryon Slammed
articles.content:
Wholesale Arrests of Members of S. HQs of Pomminryon Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the North Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) released a statement Thursday slamming the puppet south Korean regime for stirring up the whirlwind of the wholesale arrests of members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, defying the strong public protest and censure.

Recently it put into custody the acting chairman of the headquarters and a member of its organization committee.
					
					 It also held trials of the permanent representative and three others of the Youth and students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 The recent acts clearly prove that the regime is working with blood-shot eyes to stamp out the south headquarters which takes the lead in the struggle for the independence, peace and reunification of the nation.
					
					 The hideous acts of sycophancy and submission, moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen and unpopular rule by the puppet regime have seriously ruined the livelihood of the people.
					
					 The south Koreans' wrath are running sky-high and the candlelight of resistance flare up in different parts of south Korea, pushing the present regime into a tight corner. 
					
					 It is against this backdrop that the regime is stirring up the insane whirlwind of suppressing pro-reunification movement organizations and arresting pro-reunification figures in a bid to check the south Koreans' backlash and tide over the ruling crisis.
					
					 The situation proves that the dark era of "yusin" fascist dictatorship, in which those who uttered even a word of reunification were thrown into prison being subject to execution, has come again.
					
					 No matter how desperately the ruling forces may try, they can never stem the just struggle of the south Koreans for independent reunification and democracy.

articles.title: U.S. Pressure upon S. Korea for Its Increased Payment of Upkeep of U.S. Forces under Fire

U.S. Pressure upon S. Korea for Its Increased Payment of Upkeep of U.S. Forces under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea on July 22 carried an article denouncing the U.S. for working hard to force the south Korean people to pay a stupendous amount of money for the upkeep of U.S. imperialist aggressor forces.
					 The article went on:
					
					 It was confirmed recently that 533.8 billion won is left over out of the upkeep south Korea provided to the U.S. forces in the five years.

 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court in south Korea sentenced the permanent representative of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to three years in prison on charge of violation of the "Security Law", according to south Korean KBS on July 23.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe a la delegacion de Republica Arabe de Siria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe a la delegacion de Republica Arabe de Siria
						
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se reunio el dia 24 con la delegacion de la Republica Arabe de Siria encabezada por el subsecretario general del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS) Abdullah al-Ahmar que realiza una visita a la RPDC para participar en las festividades del 60o aniversario del triunfo del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los miembros de la delegacion y el encargado de negocios a.i. de Siria en Corea, Haissam Saad, los secretarios del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam y Kim Yang Gon, y el primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Kim Kye Gwan.
					
					Luego de intercambiar saludos cordiales con los huespedes, el Mariscal departio con estos.
					
					En la ocasion, Abdullah al-Ahmar le traslado el saludo cordial de parte de Su Excelencia Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria Bashar al-Assad.
					
					Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en guerra, el visitante felicito calurosamente en nombre del Presidente y el pueblo siriacos al Mariscal y al amistoso pueblo coreano.
					
					Y deseo al Mariscal la buena salud y felicidad y al pueblo coreano los exitos en su lucha por construir un Estado prospero.
					
					Expreso la esperanza de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre la RAS y la RPDC se fortalezcan continuamente conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					Tras dar calida bienvenida a la delegacion siriaca que vino desde lejos para participar en los actos de festejo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en guerra, el Mariscal envio saludo combativo al Presidente y pueblo de Siria.
					
					Dijo que le complace reunirse con el subsecretario general recibido en varias ocasiones por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y subrayo que el partido y el gobierno de Siria dieron un gran estimulo al pueblo coreano al enviar su delegacion a los festejos de la mencionada efemeride.
					
					Intercambio con los huespedes los criterios sobre como desarrollar aun mas las relaciones Corea-Siria y sobre la situacion regional y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso y cordial.
					
					El jefe de la delegacion siriaca dedico al Mariscal presente preparado con toda sinceridad.
					
					El Mariscal expreso profundo agradecimiento por el respecto.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion china

articles.title: CDN ofrece banquete en honor de los chinos
articles.content:
CDN ofrece banquete en honor de los chinos
						
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio este jueves en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang un banquete en honor de la delegacion de veteranos del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino y la delegacion de veteranos y familiares de martires del mismo cuerpo que estan de visita en Corea para tomar parte en los actos festivos del 60o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
